diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Diverticulitis with perforated sigmoid colon and intra-abdominal abscess
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute abdominal pain and has a history of diverticulosis. Imaging studies revealed extensive diverticula throughout the colon, and there was evidence of an intra-abdominal abscess consistent with perforation. Management included addressing post-operative complications such as hypotension, atrial fibrillation, pneumonia, fever, hyperglycemia, and fluid overload.
